Package Solvers.ResolutionOld

Class Resolution

java.lang.Object
Solvers.Solver
Solvers.ResolutionOld.Resolution
public abstract class Resolution extends Solver
The class implements a SAT-Solver with the resolution principle. Created by ohlbach on 18.10.2018. Resolution is combined with various simplification techniques:
- Propagation of unit clauses
- forward and backward subsumption
- forward and backward replacement resolution

Four different strategies are available:
- INPUT: only resolvents with input clauses are allowed (complete only for Horn clauses) - SOS: a percentage of the input clauses make up the Set of Support (SOS)
resolvents are put into the SOS
- POSITIVE: one parent clause must be a positive clause
- NEGATIVE: one parent clause must be a negative clause.

Unit clauses are exchanged between different solvers.
Therefore various resolution solvers can operate in parallel and exchange unit clauses as intermediate results.

    • equivalenceClasses

      private EquivalenceClasses equivalenceClasses
      EquivalenceClasses manage equivalent literals. In each equivalence class the literals are mapped to their representatives, which is always the predicate with the smallest number.

    • contradictionHandler

      private BiConsumer<Integer,it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntArrayList> contradictionHandler
      If an equivalence p = -p occurs or can be derived, this function is called. It adds an Unsatisfiable task to the task queue.

    • insertHandler

      private Consumer<Clause> insertHandler
      This function is called when a new disjunction is to be inserted. It generates a simplifyBackwards task.

    • Resolution

      public Resolution(Integer solverNumber, HashMap<String,Object> solverParameters, ProblemSupervisor problemSupervisor)
      constructs a new Resolution solver.
      Parameters:
      solverNumber - for distinguishing different solvers of the same type, but different parameters
      solverParameters - contains the parameters for controlling the solver
      problemSupervisor - coordinates several solvers.

  • Method Details

    • parseParameters

      public static ArrayList<HashMap<String,Object>> parseParameters(HashMap<String,String> parameters, StringBuilder errors, StringBuilder warnings)
      parses a HashMap with key-value pairs:
      Parameters:
      parameters - the parameters with the keys "seed", "strategy", "percentageOfSOSClauses", "limit"
      errors - for error messages
      warnings - for warnings
      Returns:
      a list of HashMaps with keys "seed" and "sos", "limit".

    • help

      public static String help()
      gives a string with descriptions of the available parameters.
      Returns:
      a description of the available parameters.

    • solve

      public Result solve()
      This method controls the entire resolution sequence 1. All local data are initialized
      2. All basic clauses are transformed to clauses and distributed to the primary and secondary clause lists.
      Equivalences are turned to equivalence classes
      All literals are mapped to the representatives in their classes.
      3. The initial causes are put into the task queue for simplifications.
      4. Resolution and simplification is started until
      - a contradiction is formed or
      - the primaryClauses became empty or
      - the resolution limit is exceeded or
      - the thread is interrupted.
      Specified by:
      solve in class Solver
      Returns:
      the result of the resolution sequence.

    • initializeData

      private void initializeData()
      initializes resolution specific data structures

    • initializeClauses

      private Result initializeClauses() throws InterruptedException
      This method translates all basic clauses into Clause data structures. Equivalent literals are replaced by their representatives.
      Returns:
      possibly Unsatisfiable
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • resolve

      private Result resolve() throws InterruptedException, Unsatisfiable
      performs the resolution search until a solution is found, or the number of resolvents exceeds the limit. - two parent literals are chosen.
      - the resolvent is generated
      - the resolvent itself is simplified.
      - if it survives it causes forward subsumption and replacement resolution
      - further simplifications are put into the task queue.
      - the task queue is worked off.
      Returns:
      the result of the search
      Throws:
      InterruptedException
      Unsatisfiable

    • selectParentLiterals

      private void selectParentLiterals(CLiteral[] parentLiterals)
      The method chooses two parent literals for the next resolution step. The first parent clauses is chosen randomly from the primary clauses.
      Shorter clauses are preferred (quadratically in size)

      For the second parent clause the literals of the first parent clauses are searched for: - a shorter second parent clause
      - a parent clause with a literal that merges with a literal in the first clause
      - if none such clause is found, the first one complementary to the last literal in the clause is chosen.
      Parameters:
      parentLiterals - to store the parent literals.

    • isPrimary

      private boolean isPrimary(Clause clause, boolean input)
      checks if the clause ought to be a primary clause or a secondary clause. It depends on the strategy and the situation (processing input clauses or resolvents)
      Strategy:
      INPUT: all input clauses are primary, the resolvents are secondary
      POSITVE: positive clauses are primary, all others are secondary
      NEGATIVE: negative clauses are primary, all others are secondary
      SOS: input = true: a randomly chosen percentage (percentageOfSOSClauses) is primary
      all resolvents are primary.
      Parameters:
      clause - a clause to be checked
      input - true if the clause is one of the input clauses
      Returns:
      true if the clause is to be inserted into the primary clauses.

    • simplifyBackwards

      private void simplifyBackwards(Clause clause)
      checks if the clause is subsumed or some of its literals can be resolved away by replacement resolution. If the clause is subsumed, it is removed from the clause lists and the literal index
      - if the clause is in the primaryClauses and the subsumer is in the secondary clauses,
      the subsumer is moved to the primaryClauses
      - Example for replacement resolution:
      p,q,r
      -p,r
      p in the first clause can be removed.
      In more complex examples, several literals can be removed at once.
      If the resulting clause is a unit clause, it generates a importTrueLiteral task.
      Removing clauses may produce pure literals, whose negation can be made true and therefore generates a importTrueLiteral task.
      - Shortened clauses may trigger forward subsumptions and forward replacement resolutions. Therefore thy generate a corresponding task.
      Parameters:
      clause -

    • simplifyForward

      private void simplifyForward(Clause clause)
      does forward subsumption and replacement resolution
      Parameters:
      clause -

    • importTrueLiteral

      public Result importTrueLiteral(int literal)
      This method is called be the problemSupervisor, when another solver derives a true literal. It generates a trueLiteral task.
      Overrides:
      importTrueLiteral in class Solver
      Parameters:
      literal - a new true literal

    • addTrueLiteralTask

      private void addTrueLiteralTask(int literal, boolean forward, String reason)
      turns the literal into a trueLiteralTask. If it is a unit resolvent then it is forwarded to the problem supervisor.
      Parameters:
      literal - a unit literal.

    • processTrueLiteral

      private Result processTrueLiteral(int literal)
      computes the consequences of a new true literal - all clauses with this literal are removed
      - pure literals cause new true literals
      - all occurrences of the negated literal are removed
      - for each shortened clause which became a unit clause, a new task is created.
      - if the primary clauses became empty, the model is completed
      Parameters:
      literal - a new true literal
      Returns:
      the result of a model completion or null

    • processElimination

      private void processElimination(int eliminateLiteral) throws Unsatisfiable
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • completeModel

      private Result completeModel()
      completes a model after resolution has finished. Strategy INPUT or SOS: all remaining clauses should be true
      Strategy POSITIVE: all remaining clauses are negative of mixed.
      Choose an unassigned negative literal.
      Strategy NEGATIVE: all remaining clauses are positive of mixed.
      Choose an unassigned positive literal.
      Returns:
      Satisfiable or Erraneous (if something went wrong).

    • completeEliminations

      private void completeEliminations()

    • insertClause

      private void insertClause(Clause clause, boolean primary, String reason) throws Unsatisfiable
      inserts the clause into the local data structures. - If the clause is a unit clause, it generates a trueLiteralTask
      - If it is an initial clause, it generates a simplifyBackwards task.
      These tasks are sorted such that longer clauses are simplified first (subsumption and replacement resolution).
      Parameters:
      clause - the clause to be inserted.
      primary - determines whether the clause is inserted into primaryClauses or secondaryClauses.
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • removeClause

      private void removeClause(Clause clause, int ignoreLiteral)
      removes a clause from primary/secondary clauses and from the literal index (except ignoreLiteral)
      Parameters:
      clause - the clause to be removed
      ignoreLiteral - the literal not to remove from the index

    • replaceClause

      private void replaceClause(Clause primaryClause, Clause secondaryClause)
      This method is called when secondary clause subsumes a primary clause. In this case the subsumer must be moved to the primary clauses.
      Parameters:
      primaryClause - a primary clause
      secondaryClause - a secondary clause which subsumes a primary clause.

    • removeLiteral

      private boolean removeLiteral(CLiteral cLiteral)
      removes the literal from its clause and the literal index. - If the clause is already marked 'removed' nothing happens.
      - If the shortened clause is a unit clause, it generates a trueLiteralTask, and is removed.
      Parameters:
      cLiteral - the literal to be removed
      Returns:
      true if the clause is still there.

    • purityAndElimination

      private void purityAndElimination() throws Unsatisfiable
      This method checks all predicates for purity and elimination. A literal p is pure if there are no clauses with p any more.
      In this case -p can be made true.
      A literal p can be eliminated if it occurs only once in the clauses, say in clause C. In this case all clauses with -p can be replaced with their resolvent with C.
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • isEquivalence

      private boolean isEquivalence(Clause clause)
      checks if the clause is part of an equivalence like (p,q) and (-p,-q)
      Parameters:
      clause - a clause to be checked (p,q)
      Returns:
      true if there is another clause (-p,-q)

    • findEquivalence

      private boolean findEquivalence(Clause clause) throws Unsatisfiable
      This method checks if the clause is part of an equivalence (p,q) (-p,-q) If this is the case:
      - -p == q is inserted into the equivalence classes
      - a processEquivalence task is generated
      Parameters:
      clause - the clause to be checked
      Returns:
      true if an equivalence has been found.
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • processEquivalence

      private Result processEquivalence(int fromLiteral, int toLiteral) throws Unsatisfiable
      This method replaces all occurrences of fromLiteral by toLiteral. Generated tautologies are ignored.
      Double literals are avoided.
      The new clauses are backwards simplified.
      Parameters:
      fromLiteral - antecedent
      toLiteral - succedent
      Returns:
      null
      Throws:
      Unsatisfiable

    • toString

      public String toString()
      lists the clauses and the literal index as a string.

      Returns:
      the clauses and the literal index as a string.

      Returns:
      the clauses and the literal index as a string.
